intro: Pyrethrum acmella, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its bright yellow or orange disc flowers surrounded by white to pink ray florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. The flowers are also used in the production of natural insecticides due to their pyrethrin content.
